sect1.title: Requirements
sect1.para: Linux operating system with Java 5.0 RTE (or any later version) installed. If Java is not installed on your system, the standalone version of KNIME contains a Java runtime version that will be used automatically. If you have an earlier version of Java installed and you intend to install the KNIME-plugins directly into your own eclipse installation, you need to update from this website: http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/download.jsp

sect1.title: Installing KNIME
sect1.para: The installation procedure is illustrated for the standalone version of KNIME.

sect2.title: Windows users
sect2.para: Download the standalone version of KNIME from http://www.knime.org/download/win32/knime_win32_1.1.2.zip. Extract the downloaded zip file knime_win32_1.1.2.zip, to any directory for which you have write permissions.

sect2.title: Linux users
sect2.para: Download the standalone version of KNIME from http://www.knime.org/download/linux/knime_linux_1.1.2.tar.gz. Extract the downloaded .tar.gz file knime_linux_1.1.2.tar.gz, to any directory for which you have write permissions.

This is all that is needed to install KNIME. There is no need to execute a Setup application or set any variables. KNIME will not leave many traces in your system. It will create a .knime sub-directory in your home directory to store its local settings.

sect2.title: Sample data sets
sect2.para: After installation, in the root directory of KNIME (knime_1.1.2) you will find the sub directory "IrisDataset", which contains a small dataset on iris plants. The dataset has five columns (attributes). Each row represents a single iris plant. The first four columns describe the width and length of the two characteristical leaves of an iris plant. The fifth column describes the class the iris belongs to. This dataset represents a simple classification dataset and can easily be used to get to know to the basics of KNIME. More example datasets can be downloaded from our web site at http://www.knime.org/download/datasets.zip.
